segment.source: Deployment Troubleshooting and Log Files
segment.target: Deployment Troubleshooting and Log Files

segment.source: Deployment Troubleshooting and Log Files
segment.target: Deployment Troubleshooting and Log Files

segment.source: Deployment Troubleshooting and Log Files
segment.target: Deployment Troubleshooting and Log Files

segment.source: The following section describes the relationship between common deployment scenarios and their associated log files.
segment.target: The following section describes the relationship between common deployment scenarios and their associated log files.

segment.source: Windows® deployment is a highly customizable process, which has the potential for many points of failure.
segment.target: Windows® deployment is a highly customizable process, which has the potential for many points of failure.

segment.source: Identifying the specific point of failure you have encountered begins with understanding how the underlying technologies work.
segment.target: Identifying the specific point of failure you have encountered begins with understanding how the underlying technologies work.

segment.source: Windows Setup Scenario
segment.target: Windows Setup Scenario

segment.source: This scenario begins with completing Windows Setup on a new computer, so that you arrive at the desktop.
segment.target: This scenario begins with completing Windows Setup on a new computer, so that you arrive at the desktop.

segment.source: This scenario is most common when you are creating a reference image.
segment.target: This scenario is most common when you are creating a reference image.

segment.source: This process is also known as the first user experience.
segment.target: This process is also known as the first user experience.

segment.source: As shown in the following illustration, the key to solving failures is identifying where you are in the installation process and when a failure occurs.
segment.target: As shown in the following illustration, the key to solving failures is identifying where you are in the installation process and when a failure occurs.

segment.source: Because you are creating a new installation, the hard drive is not initially available, so Windows Setup writes logs into memory, specifically in a Windows PE session (X:Windows).
segment.target: Because you are creating a new installation, the hard drive is not initially available, so Windows Setup writes logs into memory, specifically in a Windows PE session (X:Windows).

segment.source: After the hard drive is formatted, Setup continues logging directly onto the new hard drive (C:Windows).
segment.target: After the hard drive is formatted, Setup continues logging directly onto the new hard drive (C:Windows).

segment.source: Log files created during the Windows PE session are temporary.
segment.target: Log files created during the Windows PE session are temporary.

segment.source: windows setup log files
segment.target: windows setup log files

segment.source: When a failure occurs in Windows Setup, review the entries in the Setuperr.log file first, then the Setupact.log file second, and then other log files as needed.
segment.target: When a failure occurs in Windows Setup, review the entries in the Setuperr.log file first, then the Setupact.log file second, and then other log files as needed.

segment.source: Windows Setup-Related Log Files
segment.target: Windows Setup-Related Log Files

segment.source: Log file
segment.target: Log file

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Location
segment.target: Location

segment.source: Setupact.log
segment.target: Setupact.log

segment.source: Primary log file for most errors that occur during the Windows installation process.
segment.target: Primary log file for most errors that occur during the Windows installation process.

segment.source: There are several instances of the Setupact.log file, depending on what point in the installation process the failure occurs.
segment.target: There are several instances of the Setupact.log file, depending on what point in the installation process the failure occurs.

segment.source: It is important to know which version of the Setupact.log file to look at, based on the phase you are in.
segment.target: It is important to know which version of the Setupact.log file to look at, based on the phase you are in.

segment.source: Setup (specialize): X:\Windows\panther
segment.target: Setup (specialize): X:\Windows\panther

segment.source: Setup (OOBE), LogonUI, OEM First Run:%windir%\panther
segment.target: Setup (OOBE), LogonUI, OEM First Run:%windir%\panther

segment.source: Out-Of-Box Experience (OOBE): %windir%\panther\unattendGC
segment.target: Out-Of-Box Experience (OOBE): %windir%\panther\unattendGC

segment.source: Setuperr.log
segment.target: Setuperr.log

segment.source: High-level list of errors that occurred during the specialize phase of Setup.
segment.target: High-level list of errors that occurred during the specialize phase of Setup.

segment.source: The Setuperr.log file does not provide any specific details.
segment.target: The Setuperr.log file does not provide any specific details.

segment.source: Setup (specialize): %windir%\panther
segment.target: Setup (specialize): %windir%\panther

segment.source: Setup (specialize): %windir%\panther
segment.target: Setup (specialize): %windir%\panther

segment.target: Setup (OOBE), LogonUI, OEM First Run: %windir%\panther

segment.target: Setupapi.offline.log

segment.source: Driver failures during the Component Specialization sub-phase of the Setup specialize phase.
segment.target: Driver failures during the Component Specialization sub-phase of the Setup specialize phase.

segment.source: %windir%\inf
segment.target: %windir%\inf

segment.source: Cbs_unattend.log
segment.target: Cbs_unattend.log

segment.source: Unattended-setup servicing failures.
segment.target: Unattended-setup servicing failures.

segment.source: %windir%\panther
segment.target: %windir%\panther

segment.target: Setupapi.dev.log

segment.source: Driver failures during the oobe phase of Setup.
segment.target: Driver failures during the oobe phase of Setup.

segment.source: %windir%\inf
segment.target: %windir%\inf

segment.source: Sessions.xml
segment.target: Sessions.xml

segment.source: An XML-based transaction log file that tracks all servicing activity, based on session id, client, status, tasks, and actions.
segment.target: An XML-based transaction log file that tracks all servicing activity, based on session id, client, status, tasks, and actions.

segment.source: If necessary, the Sessions.log file will point to the DISM.log and CBS.log files for more details.
segment.target: If necessary, the Sessions.log file will point to the DISM.log and CBS.log files for more details.

segment.source: %windir%\servicing\sessions
segment.target: %windir%\servicing\sessions

segment.source: CBS.log
segment.target: CBS.log

segment.source: Servicing log file that provides more details about offline-servicing failures.
segment.target: Servicing log file that provides more details about offline-servicing failures.

segment.source: %windir%\panther
segment.target: %windir%\panther

segment.source: Offline Servicing Scenario
segment.target: Offline Servicing Scenario

segment.source: This scenario involves adding and removing updates, drivers, and language packs, and configuring other settings, without booting Windows.
segment.target: This scenario involves adding and removing updates, drivers, and language packs, and configuring other settings, without booting Windows.

segment.source: Offline servicing is an efficient way to manage existing images that are stored on a server, because it eliminates the need for recreating updated images.
segment.target: Offline servicing is an efficient way to manage existing images that are stored on a server, because it eliminates the need for recreating updated images.

segment.source: You can perform offline servicing on an image that is mounted or applied to a drive or directory.
segment.target: You can perform offline servicing on an image that is mounted or applied to a drive or directory.

segment.source: offline servicing failure analysis
segment.target: offline servicing failure analysis

segment.source: The Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) tool is the primary tool for all offline-servicing tasks.
segment.target: The Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) tool is the primary tool for all offline-servicing tasks.

segment.source: DISM runs from a command prompt from Windows PE or a running Windows operating system.
segment.target: DISM runs from a command prompt from Windows PE or a running Windows operating system.

segment.source: If a failure occurs when executing a DISM command, the tool will provide an immediate response, and log the issue in the DISM.log file.
segment.target: If a failure occurs when executing a DISM command, the tool will provide an immediate response, and log the issue in the DISM.log file.

segment.source: The Session.xml file is a transaction log file that captures all servicing activities on the target operating system.
segment.target: The Session.xml file is a transaction log file that captures all servicing activities on the target operating system.

segment.source: The Session.xml file can be used in conjunction with the DISM.log file to determine points of failures and the required servicing activity.
segment.target: The Session.xml file can be used in conjunction with the DISM.log file to determine points of failures and the required servicing activity.

segment.source: When a failure occurs in offline servicing, look at the DISM.log file first for specific errors.
segment.target: When a failure occurs in offline servicing, look at the DISM.log file first for specific errors.

segment.source: If the DISM.log file doesn’t contain any errors, review the Sessions.xml log file second, and then the CBS.log file.
segment.target: If the DISM.log file doesn’t contain any errors, review the Sessions.xml log file second, and then the CBS.log file.

segment.source: Offline Servicing Related Log Files
segment.target: Offline Servicing Related Log Files

segment.source: Log file
segment.target: Log file

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Location
segment.target: Location

segment.source: DISM.log
segment.target: DISM.log

segment.source: Primary log file for all offline actions using DISM.
segment.target: Primary log file for all offline actions using DISM.

segment.source: %windir%\logs\dism
segment.target: %windir%\logs\dism

segment.source: You can also create the DISM log file in a different location by using the /LogPath option.
segment.target: You can also create the DISM log file in a different location by using the /LogPath option.

segment.source: The level of data written to the log file can also be controlled by using the /LogLevel option.
segment.target: The level of data written to the log file can also be controlled by using the /LogLevel option.

segment.source: Sessions.xml
segment.target: Sessions.xml

segment.source: An XML-based transaction log that tracks all servicing activity, based on session id, client, status, tasks, and actions.
segment.target: An XML-based transaction log that tracks all servicing activity, based on session id, client, status, tasks, and actions.

segment.source: If necessary, the Sessions.log file will point to the DISM.log and CBS.log files for more details.
segment.target: If necessary, the Sessions.log file will point to the DISM.log and CBS.log files for more details.

segment.source: %windir%\servicing\sessions
segment.target: %windir%\servicing\sessions

segment.source: To learn more about offline servicing, see Understanding Servicing Strategies.
segment.target: To learn more about offline servicing, see Understanding Servicing Strategies.

segment.source: Online Servicing Scenario
segment.target: Online Servicing Scenario

segment.source: This scenario is servicing a running operating system.
segment.target: This scenario is servicing a running operating system.

segment.source: This scenario involves booting the computer to audit mode to add drivers, applications, and other packages.
segment.target: This scenario involves booting the computer to audit mode to add drivers, applications, and other packages.

segment.source: Online servicing is ideal for drivers if the driver packages have co-installers or application dependencies.
segment.target: Online servicing is ideal for drivers if the driver packages have co-installers or application dependencies.

segment.source: It is also efficient when the majority of your servicing packages have installers, the updates are in either .msi or KB.exe file formats, or the applications rely on Windows-installed services and technologies (such as the .NET Framework or full plug and play support).
segment.target: It is also efficient when the majority of your servicing packages have installers, the updates are in either .msi or KB.exe file formats, or the applications rely on Windows-installed services and technologies (such as the .NET Framework or full plug and play support).

segment.source: online servicing failure analysis
segment.target: online servicing failure analysis

segment.source: Like offline servicing, all logging is captured in the DISM.log, CBS.log, and Sessions.xml files.
segment.target: Like offline servicing, all logging is captured in the DISM.log, CBS.log, and Sessions.xml files.

segment.source: If a failure occurs when executing a DISM command, the tool will provide immediate response as well as log the issue in the DISM.log file.
segment.target: If a failure occurs when executing a DISM command, the tool will provide immediate response as well as log the issue in the DISM.log file.

segment.source: The Session.xml file is a transaction log file that captures all servicing activities on the target operating system.
segment.target: The Session.xml file is a transaction log file that captures all servicing activities on the target operating system.

segment.source: The Session.xml file can be used in conjunction with the DISM.log file to determine points of failures and the required servicing activities.
segment.target: The Session.xml file can be used in conjunction with the DISM.log file to determine points of failures and the required servicing activities.

segment.source: When a failure occurs in offline servicing, look at the DISM.log file for specific errors.
segment.target: When a failure occurs in offline servicing, look at the DISM.log file for specific errors.

segment.source: If the DISM.log file doesn’t contain any errors, review the Sessions.xml log file and then the CBS.log file.
segment.target: If the DISM.log file doesn’t contain any errors, review the Sessions.xml log file and then the CBS.log file.

segment.source: Online Servicing-Related Log Files
segment.target: Online Servicing-Related Log Files

segment.source: Log file
segment.target: Log file

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Location
segment.target: Location

segment.source: DISM.log
segment.target: DISM.log

segment.source: Primary log file for all online actions using DISM.
segment.target: Primary log file for all online actions using DISM.

segment.source: If necessary, DISM.log will point to CBS.log for more details.
segment.target: If necessary, DISM.log will point to CBS.log for more details.

segment.source: %windir%\logs\dism
segment.target: %windir%\logs\dism

segment.source: You can also point DISM log file to a different location by using the /LogPath command option.
segment.target: You can also point DISM log file to a different location by using the /LogPath command option.

segment.source: The log data can also be controlled by using the /LogLevel command option.
segment.target: The log data can also be controlled by using the /LogLevel command option.

segment.source: CBS.log
segment.target: CBS.log

segment.source: Secondary log file that provides more details about an online servicing failure.
segment.target: Secondary log file that provides more details about an online servicing failure.

segment.source: DISM.log will reference CBS.log for more details.
segment.target: DISM.log will reference CBS.log for more details.

segment.source: %windir%\logs\cbs
segment.target: %windir%\logs\cbs

segment.source: Sessions.xml
segment.target: Sessions.xml

segment.source: An xml based transaction log that tracks all servicing activity based on session id, client, status, tasks, and actions.
segment.target: An xml based transaction log that tracks all servicing activity based on session id, client, status, tasks, and actions.

segment.source: If necessary, Sessions.log will point to DISM.log and CBS.log for more details.
segment.target: If necessary, Sessions.log will point to DISM.log and CBS.log for more details.

segment.source: %windir%\servicing\sessions
segment.target: %windir%\servicing\sessions

segment.source: To learn more about offline servicing, see Understanding Servicing Strategies.
segment.target: To learn more about offline servicing, see Understanding Servicing Strategies.
